definition: the Opium Wars of 1840-1842 and 1860-1861
variant of 鴉|鸦[ya1]
crow

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
disk/sheet
to fight/fight/war/battle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Europeanization is the output of language contact between the English and Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 汉语的欧化现象是鸦片战争以来英汉语言接触的产物。

sentences.english: It was after Opium War that Western photography was introduced into China.
sentences.chinese: 摄影术是鸦片战争后由西方传入我国的。

sentences.english: Hong Kong was British Colony occupied for opium wars, exploitations.
sentences.chinese: 香港被英国强占，发动多次鸦片战争，侵略中国。

sentences.english: After the Opium War (1840-1842), western culture began to enter China in a large amount.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，西方文化开始大盘进入中国。

sentences.english: After the Opium War of 1840 -1842, China slowly became semi - colonial and semi - feudal society country.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建国家。

sentences.english: As for the Opium Wars, a strictly legal perspective is ludicrous .
sentences.chinese: 谈到鸦片战争，严格法律的提发是可笑的。

sentences.english: The Opium War of 1840marked a turning piont in chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 1840年爆发的鸦片战争标志着中国历史的转折。

sentences.english: Before the opium war China is still an independent state of feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争前，中国仍是一个独立自主的封建制国家。

sentences.english: China never forgave the Anglos for the Opium Wars.
sentences.chinese: 因为鸦片战争，所以中国人永远不会原谅英国人。

sentences.english: After "The Second Opium War", the Westernization movement has developed.
sentences.chinese: 第二次鸦片战争后，洋务运动兴起。

sentences.english: And she must forgive the anglos for the Opium Wars.
sentences.chinese: 中国也该原谅英国人在鸦片战争中的行为。

sentences.english: After the Opium War broke out in 1840, China was reduced to a semi-colonial and semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 年鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建的社会。

sentences.english: After the Opium War, China was gradually reduced to semifeudal and semicolonial society.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐步沦为半封建半殖民地社会。

sentences.english: The British forces had been aggressing and harassing Dalian during the two opium wars.
sentences.chinese: 两次鸦片战争期间，英军曾对大连进行侵略与骚扰。

sentences.english: And this anti-drug law has its roots, and that is the Opium War.
sentences.chinese: 反毒品法有其渊源，那就是鸦片战争。

sentences.english: Qing Dynasty Opium War decline, the country mourning the right of the Treaty of Nanking.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争清朝衰，南京条约丧国权。

definition: First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)
Treaty of Nanjing (1842) that concluded the First Opium War between Qing China and Britain
Sino-French War (1883-1885) (concerning French seizure of Vietnam)
Qing government (1644-1911)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Boxer Rebellion
the Great Powers (history)
to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
Taiping Heavenly Kingdom (1851-1864)

the five treaty ports forced on Qing China by the 1842 treaty of Nanjing 南京條約|南京条约 that concluded the First Opium War, namely: Guangzhou 廣州|广州, Fuzhou 福州, Ningbo 寧波|宁波, Xiamen or Amoy 廈門|厦门 and Shanghai 上海
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
modern history (for China, from the Opium Wars until the fall of the Qing Dynasty, i.e. mid-19th to early 20th century)
Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
